main_definition: A preliminary version of a document or written work, often used as the basis for further revision.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An initial version of a plan, design, or written piece intended to be revised and improved upon
meanings_and_examples.example: The engineer prepared a draft of the blueprint before presenting it to his team.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A compulsory military enlistment for young men; conscription
meanings_and_examples.example: In some countries, all eligible males must serve in the military during their late teens or early twenties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An unfinished piece of writing, such as a story, essay, or article
meanings_and_examples.example: The author read through her draft before submitting it to the publisher for final editing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A preliminary version of something created with care but not intended to be its final form
meanings_and_examples.example: He sketched a rough draft of his painting, knowing he would refine and adjust as he progressed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used in sports referring to the action of getting closer to an opponent with intent
meanings_and_examples.example: The quarterback quickly made a move towards the defender to receive the ball, executing a perfect draft maneuver.
